TopicTitle: Dres Awareness, Show Your Support! (still not-dead :))

Articles.Content: @MoeslyArmlis Is it OK if I upload your sparkly asteroid image to the wiki?
Where is Dres?

34 minutes ago, EliteGuy3 said:

Where is Dres?

Between Jool and Duna. It is the analog for Ceres. It is a bit hard to see at first but if you zoom in, you can see its orbit.
Thanks! I could try to replicate the Dawn probe mission then.

I will help. Yay!

I've never gone interplanetary before, so this is a first. I'm also doing this in career mode. I will bring a satellite and some kerbals on a lander. (Don't have enough science for drills and ore processing, I'll setup a mining operation after I've gotten enough from Dres (And enough money to upgrade my R&D because holy hell, is it expensive). I am running stock KSP since I don't know how to download/install them yet and I'm holding off until I've conquered every planet in the Kerbol System. (Or at least until my curiosity takes over/my save gets corrupted.)

I would send more, but I can't figure out how to fit a rover on and still have space for the nuclear engines to fit into the 2.5m fairing.

Edit: I've decided I want to get more science on Minmus before going to Dres. I want to test the capabilities of my lander around the neighborhood of Kerbin first.

On 2016-06-20 at 7:32 AM, EvermoreAlpaca said:

Bill brought a few friends to Dres with him.

.............'

*Dies.

5 minutes ago, SpaceplaneAddict said:

.............'

*Dies.

A few? Looks like the whole population of Kerbin tagged along. Considering there are no cities.

I've built a payload containing a fireworks display for Dres, capable of landing from an intercept of Dres with fuel left for the displays. It contains only stock parts, but was only tested on Kerbin, so some displays may not work as intended.

Unfortunately, I don't think my PC would be able to run it without crashing the game, so I would like to submit the payload for someone else to fly. Just mention me and I'll be happy.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B2AEeT0pEyFacnZZajFFVDVPR2s

Notes: If you launch the payload by itself, with the fairing, it spontaneously explodes. You might need some struts or something.

The display was balanced so it could land without serious issues with torque, but I didn't incorporate any balance for transfer or launch craft, which has to be dealt with.

You will probably want to bring some kerbals along to enjoy the fireworks.

*Edit* The display consists of :

Two Kerbodyne 14400 (that's probably not its actual name) tanks

4 toggleable Mainsail Engines, fed off of the left over fuel from landing

1 Hammer SRB, engine facing upwards

A lot of radial decouplers

4 mini-rockets

Is 500 tons of dres stuff good? (And after this, later 2 more missions)

dres FTW!!! Go space potatoes!

Also, found this on the ksp wiki:

  Reveal hidden contents

Trivia
Dres is often disregarded and ignored among the KSP community.
YouTube user Felsmark created a video claiming that Dres is nothing but a hoax created by the Kerbal government in an attempt to add interest to the fabled planet Harvest.
Several forum users have created a group to raise awareness and show support to Dres, in the form of giant missions to the dwarf planet.
Dres was the first celestial body chosen to be the host planet of a moon for the Kopernicus Creativity Marathon.
Dres is the only other celestial body, other than Ike and Kerbin, whose terrain has been changed in only one Kopernicus planet pack. All the other planets have been edited in multiple mods like Uncharted Lands and Alternis Kerbol.
Dres is the celestial body most similar to Duna. Both have whiter areas near the poles, names that start with "D", similar orbits, low amounts of craters, and canyons that can be seen from the Map View.
 

 


 

 

How did I not notice that you found what I did on the KSP wiki? I decided to give Dres some love (and info) on the great Kerbal database.
